channel.title: BBC News - UK Politics
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Gas crisis: No chance lights will go out, says government
item.description: Business secretary Kwasi Kwarteng says the UK has "more than sufficient capacity" amid gas price spike.

item.title: Rich nations must increase climate support funds, says Boris Johnson
item.description: The UK prime minister says he is "increasingly frustrated" at support offered to poorer countries.

item.title: Probe launched into Afghan interpreter data breach
item.description: More than 250 people seeking relocation to the UK were mistakenly copied in to an email from the MoD.

item.title: Aukus: France pulls out of UK defence talks amid row
item.description: Paris is angry after Australia cancelled a submarine contract in favour of a deal with the UK and US.

item.title: MP Rosie Duffield wants meeting with Sir Keir Starmer over transgender debate
item.description: Rosie Duffield - who has been criticised by trans rights activists - says Labour's position isn't clear.

item.title: Labour pledges crackdown on private equity
item.description: The shadow chancellor says closing a tax "loophole" on fund managers' earnings could raise £440m a year.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi gifts US flag to Chorley for hosting G7 summit
item.description: The Lancashire town has welcomed politicians from around the world for the G7 Speakers' Summit.

item.title: Aukus: Truss defends security deal amid criticism
item.description: The deal will make the UK safer and could create hundreds of jobs, the new foreign secretary says.

item.title: Dan Jarvis: MP to step down as South Yorkshire Mayor
item.description: Mr Jarvis says it has been an "extraordinary privilege" to serve as South Yorkshire Mayor since 2018.

item.title: Lib Dems: Give parents Covid catch-up vouchers to spend
item.description: Sir Ed Davey calls for a fairer deal for carers, parents and business in his conference speech.

item.title: House-building reforms paused amid Conservative MP anger
item.description: Newly appointed Housing Secretary Michael Gove wants to address concerns, the BBC has been told.

item.title: Covid inquiry: Prof Hugh Pennington warns against Wales-only probe
item.description: Prof Hugh Pennington, who chaired the 2005 E. coli inquiry, says it would cause "enormous overlap".

item.title: UK security planning loose and lacks oversight, MPs and peers say
item.description: Events in Afghanistan exposed "serious weaknesses" in the UK's approach, a report says.

item.title: UK travel update: Amber list scrapped in overhaul of travel rules in England
item.description: Fully vaccinated travellers will also no longer need to take PCR tests, says the transport secretary.

item.title: Lord Bethell: Peer leaves ministerial post amid emails controversy
item.description: Lord Bethell is facing criticism for using personal accounts to conduct government business.

item.title: Gas price rises prompt urgent government talks
item.description: There are concerns the high price of wholesale gas could have a far-reaching impact on the economy.

item.title: Boris Johnson to call for climate action during US visit
item.description: Boris Johnson will also visit the White House for the first time since Joe Biden became US president.

item.title: More than half of Department for Transport cars still diesel
item.description: Figures show the department in charge of the transition away from diesel still relies on the fuel.

item.title: Reshuffle: Boris Johnson's new cabinet meets for first time
item.description: The PM gives his new line-up of ministers a "half-time pep talk", after this week's reshuffle.

item.title: Brexit: Imperial units only part of laws revamp, says No 10
item.description: Downing Street says a review of EU rules on measures is just one element of its post-Brexit agenda.

item.title: Lib Dem conference: Call to scrap Covid laws in pitch for Tory voters
item.description: Sir Ed Davey's party is targeting Conservative votes as its conference gets under way.

item.title: US politician Nancy Pelosi heads to Chorley, Lancashire for G7 summit
item.description: The Lancashire town is hosting a meeting of presiding officers - including the US Speaker of the House.

item.title: Labour losing members hand over fist under Starmer, warns John McDonnell
item.description: The ex-shadow chancellor wants talks with Sir Keir at Labour's conference over left-wing expulsions.

item.title: Aukus: US and UK face backlash over Australia defence deal
item.description: The nuclear submarine deal with Australia has angered France and raised fears of a war with China.

item.title: M25 protests: Priti Patel calls activists 'selfish'
item.description: Further protests are taking place on the London orbital motorway, as well as the M1, M3 and M11.

item.title: Dorman Long tower to be destroyed after listed status revoked
item.description: Nadine Dorries strips Historic England protection from the 1950s Dorman Long building.

item.title: GB News: I became a minority of one, says Andrew Neil
item.description: The ex-BBC presenter who quit the channel says people can decide themselves if it is too right wing.

item.title: Hillsborough: Ex-PM backs bid for law to support disaster families
item.description: Theresa May joins calls for a special independent advocate to support families in major disasters.

item.title: Senedd talks: Lib Dems right not to be in discussions, says leader
item.description: Jane Dodds is right not to help Mark Drakeford's government in the Senedd, says Lib Dem leader.

item.title: NI100: Michael D Higgins defends decision not to attend centenary event
item.description: Michael D Higgins says the title of the church service to be held in Armagh had become "political".

item.title: Military to be called in to help Scottish ambulance crews
item.description: A series of serious ambulance delays have emerged, including one where a man died after a 40-hour wait.

item.title: Energy boss: Remove green levies to cut bills
item.description: Cut soaring energy costs by paying energy levies through taxes, E.On UK boss Michael Lewis says.

item.title: Marks & Spencer blames Brexit as it closes 11 French stores
item.description: Brexit has made it "near impossible" for it to supply fresh and chilled products to France, the retailer says.

item.title: Climate change: Lord Deben says street lights not needed in rural areas
item.description: Lord Deben says not having street lights in rural areas would help meet emissions targets.

item.title: Starmer lacks election-winning vision, says Len McCluskey
item.description: The outgoing Unite leader tells the BBC he is pessimistic about Labour's chances at the next election.

item.title: Charlie Elphicke: Ex-Dover MP released after serving half of sentence for sex assaults
item.description: Ex-Dover MP Charlie Elphicke was jailed for sexually assaulting two women nine years apart.

item.title: Claims about Universal Credit fact-checked
item.description: The government and Labour traded claims about the decision to remove the £20 extra Universal Credit payment.

item.title: Nadine Dorries becomes new culture secretary
item.description: The MP for Mid Bedfordshire and former health minister replaces Oliver Dowden.

item.title: Universal credit cut will push workers into poverty, warns Tory former minister
item.description: Former cabinet minister Stephen Crabb joins calls to axe the universal credit cut as Labour pushes for a vote.

item.title: Is the Scottish Parliament really banning protests?
item.description: Holyrood is to become a "protected site" under national security rules - but will this stop protests?

item.title: London arms fair DSEI attended by Welsh government
item.description: Plaid called the event "contemptible" but the Tories said it was right for officials to go.

item.title: SDLP leader Colum Eastwood calls for new law to stop election if Stormont fails
item.description: SDLP leader Colum Eastwood says legislation is needed to halt an election if devolution collapses.

item.title: Covid: Plan B would be triggered by NHS pressure, Sajid Javid says
item.description: Government scientists are warning of a jump in Covid hospital admissions if rules are not tightened soon.

item.title: China's ambassador Zheng Zeguang banned from UK Parliament
item.description: A row erupts after Zheng Zeguang is told he is not welcome while sanctions against MPs are in place.

item.title: Inflation: Price rises see record jump as food costs soar in August
item.description: The UK inflation rate hit 3.2% in the year to August, according to the latest official figures.

item.title: Boris Johnson warns Covid risk remains as he unveils England's winter plan
item.description: But he says the UK is better placed to tackle the disease as he outlines England's winter plan.

item.title: Climate change: COP26 'a turning point for the world' - Johnson
item.description: The COP26 summit is the moment when “we have to grow up and take our responsibilities”, the UK prime minister says.

item.title: Kwasi Kwarteng on gas prices: No question of the lights going out
item.description: Any talk of an energy supply emergency is alarmist and completely misguided, the business and energy secretary says.

item.title: Lib Dems: Ed Davey angry over Conservatives' handling of social care crisis
item.description: Liberal Democrat leader Sir Ed Davey reflects on his own experience of care during his conference speech.

item.title: Westminster is a very easy place to hide if you’re an alcoholic, says Labour MP
item.description: MP Dan Carden made a moving speech to the House of Commons in July, detailing his personal battle with alcoholism.

item.title: Labour Party conference: 'Unacceptable that anybody feels unsafe', says Khan
item.description: London Mayor Sadiq Khan says it is unacceptable that anybody feels unsafe going to Labour Party conference.

item.title: Nadine Dorries: Best-selling author, nurse, reality star and, now, cabinet minister
item.description: Mistrusted by some in the arts, the new culture secretary is said by a colleague to be "up for the fight".

item.title: Lib Dem conference: Sir Ed Davey gambles on targeting Tories
item.description: The Lib Dems are facing a battle to get heard at their online conference but they are in good spirits.

item.title: Cabinet reshuffle 2021: Who is in Boris Johnson's new cabinet?
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson reshuffles his cabinet for the first time since February 2020. Who's in it now?

item.title: Party political conferences: What to expect this year
item.description: Our guide to what conferences are, when and where they're taking place, and what's likely to happen.

item.title: Liberal Democrats: Is Ed Davey sticking to his promises?
item.description: We look at the performance of the party and its leader as the Lib Dem conference gets going.

item.title: Michael Gove: What will he do with beefed-up planning and levelling up job?
item.description: Michael Gove is known as a reformer and is now in charge of controversial planning changes.

item.title: Nadhim Zahawi: Iraqi refugee to education secretary
item.description: Iraqi refugee, Teletubby merchandise salesman, pollster, millionaire - meet the new education secretary.

item.title: Cabinet reshuffle: Where did it go wrong for Gavin Williamson?
item.description: The reshuffle has seen the removal of an education secretary much criticised during the pandemic.

item.title: Liz Truss: Fast tracker who landed prime cabinet role
item.description: The life of the new foreign secretary, from left-wing parents to the top of the Conservative Party.

item.title: Who is Dominic Raab? Karate black-belt who is no stranger to controversy
item.description: The Conservative MP loses his job at the foreign office but becomes deputy PM and justice secretary.

item.title: Will Boris Johnson’s plan for the NHS work?
item.description: The prime minister believes new funds will tackle the Covid backlog - but refuses to set targets.

item.title: National Insurance: What’s the new Health and Social Care tax and how will it affect me?
item.description: A new health and social care tax is being introduced, Boris Johnson has announced.

item.title: Universal credit: When will the £20 increase stop?
item.description: The government has confirmed the £20 boost will end in the autumn.

item.title: Social care: Will people still have to sell their homes?
item.description: In 2019, the Conservatives pledged no-one should have to sell their home to pay for their care.

item.title: Universal credit £20 drop: 'I'm used to hunger pains'
item.description: Under 25s are losing the biggest percentage of their income when the payments go down in October.

item.title: Patrick Harvie and Lorna Slater: Who are the new Green ministers?
item.description: Patrick Harvie and Lorna Slater are the first Green politicians to hold ministerial office in the UK.

item.title: Lib Dem leader Ed Davey wants to target Tory heartlands
item.description: Smashing Tory dominance in the party's traditional areas is Liberal Democrats leader Ed Davey's plan. Can it work?

item.title: Levelling up: The seaside town debating what change is needed
item.description: As a report says levelling up plans must consider local views, people in Rhyl debate the changes needed.

item.title: Afghanistan: Who originally supported Trump's deal with the Taliban?
item.description: UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace now calls it a "rotten" deal but supported it at the time.

item.title: Sent to Halifax: One town's asylum story
item.description: What life is like for asylum seekers in a Yorkshire town - and what locals think about accepting more.

item.title: Woke: Compliment or criticism, it is now fuelling the culture wars
item.description: The surprising history of a term increasingly thrown around in UK political debate.

item.title: Afghanistan: Why can't the UK hold Kabul airport without the US?
item.description: The US and UK have different timetables for the effort to evacuate people from Afghanistan

item.title: Boris Johnson feels MPs' anger during Afghanistan debate
item.description: After a year of flat debates, a full Commons proved harder for the PM to navigate, writes Jessica Parker.
